thread.title: Giovinco limps off for Toronto FC after Onyewu tackle
thread.title_full: Giovinco limps off for Toronto FC after Onyewu tackle

title: Giovinco limps off for Toronto FC after Onyewu tackle
text:
0 Mar 11, 2017 22:51:54 The Italy international limped off just before halftime of the Reds' trip to face the Philadelphia Union. 
Sebastian Giovinco exited Toronto FC's 2-2 draw with the Philadelphia Union on Saturday with a leg injury after absorbing a rough tackle from Oguchi Onyewu. 
Howard returns against Red Bulls 
The Italy international limped off the field in first-half stoppage time at Talen Energy Stadium, with Tosaint Ricketts replacing him up top. Giovinco appeared to be favoring his right quad and the team later announced he had suffered a leg contusion. 
Jozy Altidore drew a penalty on the subsequent free kick, and the U.S. striker converted to make it 1-1 after Jay Simpson's 11th-minute opener for Philadelphia. Justin Morrow then gave the visitors 71st-minute lead before C.J. Sapong equalized two minutes later. Related
